title: Kalman Smoother-Based Method for Fault Initiation Time Traceability and Localization in Trains
authors: Jincheng Wang, Junqi Liu, Chenglin Wen
publish: 2025 CAA Symposium on Fault Detection, Supervision, and Safety for Technical Processes (SAFEPROCESS)
abstract: This paper proposes a Kalman smoother-based method for tracing the fault initiation time and locating faults in train systems. The method combines forward Kalman filtering and backward smoothing algorithms, utilizing the dynamic model and measurements of the train system to achieve precise state estimation. First, the forward Kalman filter estimates the train state, providing preliminary state predictions and error covariance. Then, the Kalman smoothing algorithm refines the state estimates by incorporating future measurements, improving the accuracy of fault state estimation. Based on the error covariance performance index analysis technique, the fault initiation time is determined, and the specific subsystem or component where the fault occurs is located by analyzing anomalies in the state estimates. Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed method effectively achieves early fault detection, precise localization, and traceability.

title: Integrated Security Control of ICPS Based on GCRA-RF under Progressive Stealthy FDI Attacks
authors: Yajie Li, Yuankui He, Chenjing Lu
publish: 2025 CAA Symposium on Fault Detection, Supervision, and Safety for Technical Processes (SAFEPROCESS)
abstract: For a class of ICPS simultaneously subject to PS-FDI attacks and actuator faults, this paper investigates the integrated security control and communication co-design problem by fusing data-driven techniques with mechanism analysis methods under the D-ADETCS framework. First, a class of FDI attack models with progressive target selection capabilities is established, comprehensively considering the attack’s concealment, effectiveness, and target selectivity. Second, an event-triggered mechanism is deployed at the front end of the execution-side network, constructing the D-ADETCS framework to alleviate data transmission congestion in the dual-end communication network. Third, a data-driven GCRA-RF attack reconstruction prediction model is developed to restore system data contaminated by PS-FDI. Additionally, Robust control units are designed to achieve passive intrusion tolerance against cyber attacks and active fault tolerance against actuator failures. The robust observer and integrated safety controller are developed by leveraging analytical methodologies, including Lyapunov-Krasovskii functionals and the linear affine Bessel-Legendre inequality. Finally, the effectiveness of the proposed method is verified through simulations on a quadruple-tank system.

title: SAR Image Classification Using Edge-Preserving Filters
authors: Barış Akkuş, Ahmet Elbir, Ali Can Karaca
publish: 2025 9th International Symposium on Multidisciplinary Studies and Innovative Technologies (ISMSIT)
abstract: Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) imaging systems play a critical role in the field of remote sensing due to their ability to provide data independently of weather conditions and capture the structural details of surfaces. However, the presence of speckle noise in SAR images blurs class boundaries and reduces classification accuracy. Therefore, filtering methods that suppress noise while preserving edge integrity are of great importance prior to classification. Beyond speckle suppression, these filters enhance spatial consistency by making neighboring pixels more homogeneous, thereby reducing intraclass variance and facilitating the separation of different land cover types. In recent years, edge-preserving filters such as Bilateral Filtering (BF), Domain Transform (DT), and Fast Guided Smoother (FGS) have gained prominence. Nevertheless, their effects on different machine learning algorithms have not yet been sufficiently investigated. In this study, a systematic analysis was carried out on four benchmark datasets (SFBay_C, SFBay_L, Flevo_C, Flevo_L), employing classical machine learning methods such as Support Vector Machines (SVM), Random Forests (RF), and k-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) as baseline classifiers. Performances before and after filtering were comprehensively compared. The experimental results demonstrate that edge-preserving filters, particularly in SVM-based classifications, provide substantial improvements in overall accuracy (OA). Furthermore, comparison of classification maps with ground truth data revealed that filtering enhances both numerical performance and visual quality. In conclusion, integrating edge-preserving filters with machine learning models in SAR imagery not only improves classification accuracy but also supports the reliable mapping of complex environments.

title: An Intelligent Product Recommendation System using Machine Learning and Hybrid Filtering Approaches
authors: Krishna Kumar, Abhishek Kumar, Sachin Ahuja
publish: 2025 International Conference on Intelligent and Secure Engineering Solutions (CISES)
abstract: In the modern digital commerce era, providing personalized item recommendations is critical to improving engagement and satisfaction of users. This study demonstrates an intelligent hybrid system of recommendations combining collaborative filtering (SVD++ algorithm), content-based filtering (TF-IDF vectorization and cosine similarity computation), and sentiment analysis (XGBoost classifier). The system is tested against the Amazon All Beauty Review Dataset, where every module is tested separately before combining as a final hybrid model. The hybrid system performs better than any individual module, with an accuracy of 92.17%, Precision@5 of 1.0000, RMSE of 0.7986, and MAE of 0.7729, and is highly accurate in both ranking and predicting scores. The hybrid system can easily tackle cold-start problems and provides higher-quality recommendations and is implementable in real-world e-commerce websites. The combination of varied fields of technique not only improves performance but also ensures scalability and reliability of the recommendation system with dynamic users' behavior and preferences.

title: Non-Invasive Bioactive Bio patch for Astronauts Gut Health Monitoring
authors: Meenakshi Munjal, Astha Rawat, Anshika Srivastava
publish: 2025 International Conference on Intelligent and Secure Engineering Solutions (CISES)
abstract: Microgravity, EM radiation, nutritional constraints, and psychological stress induce major alterations during long space missions resulting in an enormous effect on the digestion, and metabolism of the gut microbiota. Research from the ISS mission and NASA Twins Study shows that spaceflight reduces beneficial bacteria, alters food intake, breaks up microbial diversity, and impairs immunological function, leading to metabolic inefficiencies, and gastrointestinal disorders. Because of the unstable longevity of probiotics, the restricted amount of nutrition available, and the reduced metabolism in microgravity, existing have significant space limitations in microgravity. This paper addresses the creation of a non-invasive bioactive biopatch that regulates human gut microbiota, also includes transdermally absorptive system for astronauts probiotic/metabolic supplementation and gut health monitoring to achieve optimal digestion, and metabolic performances.

title: Transformative AI Technologies in High-Voltage Systems: A Review of Advances in Predictive Maintenance, Fault Detection, and Grid Optimization
authors: Ian B. Benitez, Melodia D. Pahati
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Engineering and Technology (IICAIET)
abstract: High voltage engineering has evolved rapidly, driven by the growing need for efficient energy transmission and the integration of renewable energy into modern power grids, including urban areas. Innovations such as HVDC systems are central to this transformation, ensuring that grids can handle the increasing complexity and demand for sustainable energy. However, challenges remain, especially when it comes to coordinating insulation in hybrid AC/DC systems and maintaining the resilience of the overall infrastructure. This review looks at how Artificial Intelligence (AI) can help tackle these challenges, focusing on its role in fault detection, predictive maintenance, and improving system reliability. By comparing traditional methods with AI-driven solutions, we highlight how AI can enhance the scalability, efficiency, and adaptability of power systems. With AI, utilities can predict and prevent faults, optimize grid performance, and seamlessly integrate renewable energy sources into both rural and urban environments. Our goal is to provide insights for researchers, industry professionals, and policymakers on how AI can be harnessed to build more sustainable, resilient, and reliable energy systems. The insights shared here aim to help shape the future of power grids, positioning AI as a key player in the transition to cleaner, more efficient energy solutions.

title: Precedent Aware Legal Reasoning System for Turkish Jurisdiction with RAG Supported LLMs
authors: Ulaş Genç, Ömer Faruk Keskin, Nergis Pervan Akman, Ali Berkol, Derya Birant
publish: 2025 9th International Symposium on Multidisciplinary Studies and Innovative Technologies (ISMSIT)
abstract: Large Language Models have achieved impressive progress in natural language processing, yet their tendency to hallucinate undermines reliability in high-stakes domains such as law. This paper presents a precedent-grounded Retrieval-Augmented Generation framework for legal question answering in the Turkish judicial system. The framework integrates dense retrieval with domain-tuned embeddings and sparse retrieval with BM25 and introduced two domain-adapted models: LexiTurk111M for retrieval and LexiTurk-14B for generation. Compared to strong baselines, the system delivers clear gains in retrieval accuracy, answer correctness, and faithfulness, while substantially reducing hallucinations. In particular, LexiTurk14B outperforms its base Qwen3-14B, with correctness increasing from 2.10 to 3.10 in closed-book and 4.23 with RAG. These results highlight the effectiveness of precedent-grounded RAG and establish a reproducible path toward explainable and trustworthy legal AI in under-resourced languages.

title: A Multimodal CNN Approach to Static Object Recognition Using RGB and Depth Data
authors: Idress Husien
publish: 2025 9th International Symposium on Multidisciplinary Studies and Innovative Technologies (ISMSIT)
abstract: Simple problem in computer vision is the recognition of objects, being mainly useful in robotics where accurate perception is crucial. Conventional, single modal methods that are primarily based on RGB images are often sensitive to complicated textures and varying lighting conditions. To tackle these problems, this paper presents a MM-CNN for static object recognition aggregating RGB and depth information. Built upon a two-branched CNN architecture, the proposed method adopts a dedicated lightweight CNN for depth data and a pre-trained VGG16 model for visual features extraction from RGB images. At the stage after which extracted features are combined in a concatenation manner, a classification full connection layer is connected. The model was tested against benchmark datsets with pairs of RGB and depth images. The experimental results establish that multi-modal data fusion greatly enhances the accuracy of object recognition in comparison with single modal. The proposed method is demonstrated to be a solid and efficient solution for static environment, which can be applied in robotic perception.

title: Pneumonia Detection using Fast AI ResNet50 Model
authors: Mousumi Karmakar, Peragun Lalith Kumar, Nella Bharath Kumar, Chakali Tharun, Nadipineni Keshava Naidu, Sumit Kumar Banshal
publish: 2025 International Conference on Intelligent and Secure Engineering Solutions (CISES)
abstract: Pneumonia remains a significant public health challenge in underdeveloped regions, where timely diagnosis is often hindered by limited resources and delayed medical intervention. To address this issue, an automated diagnostic system was developed using the ResNet50 convolutional neural network architecture and the FastAI deep learning framework. Leveraging transfer learning, the model was trained on chest X-ray images to accurately detect pneumonia. Despite being designed for short-term training, the system achieved strong diagnostic performance, highlighting the potential of deep learning in medical image analysis. The results indicate that such models can significantly reduce diagnostic time and improve early detection of pneumonia in underserved areas.

title: Assessment of Photovoltaic Module Degradation Through Neural Network Classification
authors: Nadira Madjoudj, Hichem Hafdaoui, Nasreddine Belhaouas, Fateh Mehareb, Houria Assem, Abdallah Bouabidi
publish: 2025 9th International Symposium on Multidisciplinary Studies and Innovative Technologies (ISMSIT)
abstract: In this study, we employed a Support Vector Machine (SVM) classifier to analyze the degradation of photovoltaic (PV) modules in Algeria after five months of operation under moderate and humid climate conditions. Utilizing a comprehensive database comprising critical variables such as short-circuit current (Isc), open-circuit voltage (Voc), maximum power (Pmax), current at maximum power (Imp), voltage at maximum power (Vmp), module temperature (Tm), ambient temperature (T amb), irradiance (G), wind direction (WD), wind speed (WS), and time stamps, our approach facilitated an effective classification of PV module performance. The SVM model successfully grouped the data, enabling us to generate heatmaps that visually represent degradation patterns. This visualization aids in interpreting results and making informed decisions, contrasting sharply with traditional analytical methods that are often more complex and less intuitive. Our findings suggest that this machine learning approach is not only effective for individual PV modules but also scalable for assessing the performance of multiple PV installations. This methodology promises to enhance monitoring strategies, providing valuable insights for the maintenance and optimization of photovoltaic systems in similar climatic regions.

title: Research on Differentiated Training of Data for Intelligent Safety-critical Software
authors: Jiankun Xu, Lijin Wu, Bojiang Liu, You Li
publish: 2025 CAA Symposium on Fault Detection, Supervision, and Safety for Technical Processes (SAFEPROCESS)
abstract: With the advancement of technology and scientific development, intelligent safety-critical software plays an increasingly critical role in modern battlefields. Traditional approaches for intelligent safety-critical software are constrained by manually designed feature dimensions, often leading to feature loss. Integrating the data characteristics of intelligent safety-critical software, this paper proposes a differentiated training method tailored to control modules, processing modules, input-output modules, and health management modules – the four core data modules. First, this work analyzes the unique attributes of intelligent safety-critical software, clarifying its high reliability, real-time performance, reusability, and attack-resistant capabilities. Second, we select appropriate training data construction methods based on varying scenarios and mission requirements, specifying training scenarios and optimizing training approaches for control data, processing data, input-output data, and health management data. Third, we implement training methods for heterogeneous safety-critical data, including stratified sampling, adversarial validation, time-series segmentation, and cross-validation, establishing a high-reliability intelligent training framework for smart safety-critical software. Finally, the method is validated through case studies, demonstrating improvements in alarm accuracy and data effectiveness, reducing fault rates and control errors, thereby verifying the proposed methodology.

title: Layered Multiband Network Architecture with Spatially Parallel Bypass for Selective and Cost-Efficient SDM Deployment
authors: Hayato Yuasa, Takuma Kuno, Yojiro Mori, Shih-Chun Lin, Motoharu Matsuura, Suresh Subramaniam, Wakako Maeda, Shigeyuki Yanagimachi, Hiroshi Hasegawa
publish: 2025 European Conference on Optical Communications (ECOC)
abstract: We propose a layered multiband optical network architecture that partially introduces SDM transmission to bypass layers. Simulations show that our scheme reduces fibre core requirements by up to 67% despite coarser routing granularity, thereby promoting efficient adoption of SDM technologies through spatially parallel optical bypass. ©2025 The Author(s)

title: Chipless RFID IR-UWB Reader for Ultra-Fast Readings
authors: Ashkan Azarfar, Raymundo Amorim, Zeshan Ali, Francois Gautier, Louis Gautier-Le Boulch, Etienne Perret
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on RFID Technology and Applications (RFID-TA)
abstract: This paper demonstrates that IR-UWB chipless RFID readers can provide significantly higher identification speeds compared to classical frequency-sweep chipless measurement methods. The performance of the designed IR-UWB reader regarding identification rate is studied using a mechanical rotating setup that allows the chipless tag to pass in front of the reader antenna at a desired speed. The angular identification range of the chipless tag is also addressed during experiments with different rotation speeds to validate the reader's performance. By optimizing the reader-PC data communication protocol and the post-processing settings, the presented IR-UWB chipless RFID reader achieves identification rates of up to 4000 detections per second.

title: H-infinity Fault-tolerant Control for Fully Actuated Systems with Its Application
authors: Hao Cai, Limin Wang, Yun Liu, Jingxian Yu, Tao Zou
publish: 2025 CAA Symposium on Fault Detection, Supervision, and Safety for Technical Processes (SAFEPROCESS)
abstract: This work tackles the challenge of robust control in engineering systems subject to external disturbances and actuator faults, by developing a dependable control scheme that achieves H∞ performance within the fully actuated system (FAS) framework. Firstly, for single-input single-output faulty system models subject to external disturbances, a controller is designed to construct a novel system incorporating error and adjacent time-step output differential information. Subsequently, the system is transformed into a FAS representation, and a robust control law is derived using minmax optimization theory. Finally, simulation studies confirm the efficacy of the proposed approach. Under fault conditions, the algorithm achieves markedly better tracking accuracy than traditional min–max robust control methods.

title: A Comprehensive Literature Review on Cotton Leaf Disease Classification Using Artificial Intelligence Techniques
authors: T.Aswini Devi, Arpit Jain
publish: 2025 International Conference on Intelligent and Secure Engineering Solutions (CISES)
abstract: Cotton is a globally significant cash crop vulnerable to numerous leaf diseases, causing considerable yield losses. Traditional detection techniques are time-consuming and error-prone. In recent years, artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, particularly machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL), have revolutionized plant disease detection. This literature review comprehensively surveys classification methods for cotton leaf disease, ranging from conventional image processing and machine learning to advanced deep learning architectures and hybrid/ensemble models. Key datasets, preprocessing techniques, performance metrics, and existing challenges are discussed. Unlike previous reviews, this study critically analyzes algorithmic strengths and limitations, highlighting the evolution from handcrafted features to automated feature learning using convolutional neural networks (CNNs). Hybrid models combining CNNs with traditional classifiers and ensemble strategies are emphasized for their improved generalization and accuracy. Additionally, challenges like dataset scarcity, model interpretability, and realworld deployment are explored. This review concludes by outlining future research directions, including few-shot learning, explainable AI, mobile-based systems, and the development of open, field-collected datasets.

title: Comparative Bandwidth Response of GaInAs and GaInAsSb Uni-Traveling Carrier Photodiodes (UTC-PDs)
authors: Amirmohamamd Miran Zadeh, Rimjhim Chaudhary, Akshay M. Arabhavi, Nikolaos Poumpouridis, Mojtaba Ebrahimi, Rinchen Behutia, Martin Leich, Olivier Ostinelli, C. R. Bolognesi
publish: 2025 European Conference on Optical Communications (ECOC)
abstract: Ternary (GalnAs) and quaternary (GalnAsSb) uni-travelling carrier photodiodes (UTC-PDs) were fabricated and compared via RF measurements. Distinct <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$f_{3 d B}$</tex> dependences on photocurrent density were observed and attributed to differing carrier mobilities, induced field effects, and heterojunction band alignment for the different absorbers. We believe this work to be the first side-by-side comparison of GalnAs- and GalnAsSb-based Type-l and Type-II UTC-PDs.

title: Low-carbon urban travel solutions integrated with IoT sensor networks and intelligent traffic management systems
authors: Shuolei Cao
publish: 2025 9th International Symposium on Multidisciplinary Studies and Innovative Technologies (ISMSIT)
abstract: The population of cities increases constantly all around the world, so transport systems of cities experience many problems with congestion and increasing levels of carbon dioxide emissions. Hence, this research analyses the application of Internet of Things (IoT) sensor networks and intelligent traffic management systems (ITMS) for low-emission urban mobility solutions. In this endeavor, the research seeks to evaluate the impact of these technologies in enhancing flow of traffic, emissions efficiency and sustainable transport systems. Self-generated survey of primary data was collected from five large cities of China where IoT based traffic management and ITMS solutions were deployed. Descriptive analysis, correlation, regression, ANOVA, chi square tests and time series analysis was used to quantify the effect of these systems. This research findings show that traffic management systems, which are based on the IoT technology cause up to 60% reduction in traffic congestion and comparable decrease in fuel consumption and CO2 emissions. As evident by results where City D, benefiting from frequent usage of public transportation and large coverage of ITMS, successfully lowered the carbon emission and congestion rate in comparison to other cities. Substantial cohesion was noted between the two transport objectives mainly; traffic flow optimization and emissions reduction where ITMS had a pivotal role to play in the emissions reduction through optimizing the traffic signals, thus leading to minimization of congestion. Also, with the increased usage of IoT in public transports there was recorded higher passenger traffic leading to more relief to roads from private cars and fumes. However, the study also reveals that there are perceived areas of difficulty namely investments in infrastructures, security of data and finally the awareness across the population about IoT and ITMS solutions. The research opens up possibilities that are important for policy makers as well as urban planners to understand how they can make travel low carbon and foster more sustainable cities. Therefore, it is necessary for theoreticians and practitioners to conduct further studies on how to extend IoT connectedness, involve citizens and overcome the security issues.

title: ECA-CNN-Driven RUL Prediction for Lithium-Ion Batteries: A Charging Data Deep Learning Approach
authors: Hao Li, Jiwei Wang, Zhongwei Deng, Yujun Shi, Chuanshi Cui, Linxuan Zhang
publish: 2025 CAA Symposium on Fault Detection, Supervision, and Safety for Technical Processes (SAFEPROCESS)
abstract: Accurate prediction of Remaining Useful Life (RUL) for lithium-ion batteries (LIBs) is vital to ensure operating safety and optimize maintenance strategies for energy storage systems. Current challenges stem from the complex interplay of multi-scale aging mechanisms. This study presents ECA-CNN-driven framework that leverages to enhance RUL prediction accuracy. Firstly, the charging data set is preprocessed to construct four characteristic curves for voltage, current, voltage difference and current difference. Then according to different prediction needs, the corresponding input feature matrix is constructed. Finally, the feature matrix and the fused efficient channel attention-convolutional neural network model are fused to realize the RUL prediction of lithium-ion batteries. The experimental results demonstrate that the prediction accuracy of the RUL of LIBs is as high as 98.97%.

title: Generative AI in Education and its Future Possibilities
authors: Mekha Sindhu, Sarita, Yogita Yashveer Raghav, Krishanu Kundu
publish: 2025 International Conference on Intelligent and Secure Engineering Solutions (CISES)
abstract: The launch of ChatGPT in 2022 marked a significant change in how the world perceived and interacted with GenAI tools. The ease of use and accessibility of GenAI tool was a source of both concern and intrigue. There are vast opportunities to explore the constantly changing Artificial Intelligence domain, predominantly in education, where using GenAI has potential to revolutionize the field through its ability to assist in content generation, personalized tutoring, assessment support, and administrative efficiency. This paper investigates the current and emerging role of GenAI in education by combining conceptual analysis with quantitative insights drawn from two student survey datasets. Our data-driven exploration identifies usage trends, trust levels, and perceived academic impacts across diverse academic streams. The study explores the potential roles GenAI in educational sectors primarily as student’s learning assistant, assessment and evaluation tool and a mean for administration support. While emphasizing on student-centered learning, the paper addresses key challenges in integrating GenAI into traditional educational systems, including data privacy concern, fairness, and ethical governance. By merging empirical findings with theoretical insights, this study aims to guide educators, institutions, and policymakers in the thoughtful adoption and effective use of GenAI technologies in modern education.

title: 3D Silicon Nitride Waveguide Interposers for High-Density Scale-up Chiplet Interconnects
authors: Yu Xia, Yuhao Huang, Mingfei Liu, Jie Wang, Zheng Li, Yuemin Li, Yunqi Fu, Chao Xiang
publish: 2025 European Conference on Optical Communications (ECOC)
abstract: We present a 3D multilayer routing waveguide solution targeting high-density optical connectivity for scale-up chiplet interconnects. The fabricated 3D silicon nitride waveguide interposer exhibits key performance needed for scaling to higher densities and more waveguide layers.

title: Design and Development of a Beamforming Antenna Array System for Wi-Fi 7 Applications
authors: Hung V. Nguyen, Luong D. Nguyen
publish: 2025 International Conference on Advanced Technologies for Communications (ATC)
abstract: This paper presents the design and simulation of a compact 1×4 microstrip patch antenna array featuring integrated U-shaped and H-shaped slot structures and a switched-line phase-shifting feed network for tri-band beamforming in Wi-Fi 7 applications. Operating at 2.4 GHz, 5 GHz, and 6 GHz, the proposed array achieves impedance bandwidths exceeding 14% at each band, with S11 below –10 dB and realized gains of 2.01 dBi, 3.94 dBi, and 5.32 dBi, respectively. Beam steering is accomplished across five discrete angles (±45°, ±15°, 0°) using PIN-diode-controlled phase shifters, although robust tri-band matching is maintained primarily in the +45° configuration. At 6 GHz, the effective steering range is reduced due to feed network dispersion and mutual coupling effects. Despite these limitations, the antenna maintains efficiencies of 44–48% and sidelobe suppression above 12 dB on a cost-effective FR-4 substrate, offering a compact and scalable solution for next-generation Wi-Fi 7 access points and IoT devices.

title: Arabic Script as Flexible Chipless RFID Tags for Enhanced Product Advertisements
authors: Jawad Yousaf
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on RFID Technology and Applications (RFID-TA)
abstract: This work presents the design and analysis of flexible Arabic words as chipless RFID tags for product advertisement applications. The Arabic words (door, book, chicken, sea, and milk) are etched on the flexible paper substrate using copper material. The backscattered reflection from the tags in terms of their radar cross section (RCS) is studied using a finite-difference time-domain (FDTD) method in the frequency range of 1-12 GHz. The analysis reflects that each of the analyzed tags possesses a unique EM signature that could be used for its identification. With such tags, products can be identified visually and electromagnetically, thus reducing the need for separate barcodes for different products.

title: Building Trust and Improve Security of Vehicle User using Modern and Effective Solutions for Accessing Services in Smart Environment
authors: Amit Kumar Tyagi, Khushboo Tripathi, Gesu Thakur, Ganesh Gupta, Shrikant Tiwari, Sheetal Laroiya, Shabnam Kumari
publish: 2025 International Conference on Intelligent and Secure Engineering Solutions (CISES)
abstract: As smart environments develop, the dimensions of connected vehicles with urban services such as smart parking, automated tolling, and EV charging raise new challenging issues in trust and security. In this work, we introduce a modular and adaptive framework for providing secure identity management, real-time trust assessment, and policy-based access control using various blockchain, and AI-based mechanisms. The architecture is developed using federated identity, public key infrastructure, and a dynamic trust tensor model to provide quantitative relationship representations of vehicles, users, and infrastructure interactions. We employ edge-cloud storage, Zero Trust architectures, and secure communications standards (DSRC, 5G, MQTT) that provide the lowest latency possible, the best privacy, and resistance to spoofing and Sybil attacks. The implementation based on simulators from the SUMO and Veins platform, the Hyperledger network, and smart contract framework, shows better performance results across aggregate performance metrics (e.g., 96.8% trust assessment accuracy; 12ms avg response time; 0.3% breach rate). Overall, the designs we developed appear to provide vehicle-to-everything (V2X) services better than models that already establish their models successfully such as SCBTM, LSCP and PT-RBAC in terms of reliability, scalability and real-world deployability. This work begins to set out the basis for future work in trust-aware, secure V2X service frameworks, that integrate and leverage a transportation intelligent systems infrastructure.

title: Waste-to-Coin: A Blockchain-Based Ecosystem for Exchanging Waste Products for Digital Tokens
authors: Aakarshan Gupta, Urvashi Chugh, Mukul Aggarwal, Akshat Pandey, Anand Mishra
publish: 2025 International Conference on Intelligent and Secure Engineering Solutions (CISES)
abstract: The rapid increase in global waste emissions requires innovative solutions to improve sustainability and promote responsible waste management. This study presents an ecosystem for the conversion of waste into currencies on a blockchain-based basis, which facilitates the exchange of recyclable waste through digital tokens and integrates financial initiatives into sustainability initiatives. Through the use of intelligent transaction, IOT-verification based on AI and Tokenomics the machine provides real-time waste monitoring, security prevention mechanisms and decentralized responsibility thus guaranteeing a transparent and ecological waste treatment. A central aspect of this study is the analysis of the challenges regarding the scalability of the blockchain, the speed of transactions, the energy efficiency and the decentralized governance-underlying conditions, which are essential for the implementation of an ecological platform for the conversion of differences in currencies. The study refers to the latest improvements for the year 2024-2025 and takes into account new trends in blockchain-models with a focus on sustainability, decentralized waste tracking and the norms of circular economy, which improve the profitability of tokenized recycling systems. This document also explores how the integration of AI and IOT can improves the categorization and verification of cases, prevent fraudulent claims and optimize the execution of intelligent payments for the distribution of tokens. Further comparative case studies compare the efficiency of a blockchain-based waste management system with traditional recycling models and highlight the financial, ecological and operational benefits of tokenized waste exchanges. Ultimately, this study provides an integral framework for lawmakers, economic leaders and environmental actor to present ecosystems as a scalable solution for global sustainability. By creating clearer investment structures and a decentralized waste verification, the Blockchain-Time could revolutionize the waste industry and ensure a more equitable participation and a stronger engagement for the environment.

title: Nanosecond Electro-Optic Switching with Time Synchronisation for Fronthaul TSN Applications
authors: Bohao Sun, Tongyun Li, Vaigai Nayaki Yokar, Sen Shen, Stefano Stracca, Shuangyi Yan, Dimitra Simeonidou, Keren Bergman, Richard Penty, Qixiang Cheng
publish: 2025 European Conference on Optical Communications (ECOC)
abstract: This paper presents a high-speed photonic switching system with time synchronization, enabling nanosecond switching for time-sensitive fronthaul transmission. Fronthaul performance is measured, demonstrating 33ns switch-on latency and supporting 5G/6G dynamic traffic. ©2024 The Author(s)

title: Quality Relevance-Aware Multi-Head Attention for Transformers in Industrial Time-Series Prediction
authors: Ziyi Yang, Xiaofeng Yuan, Kai Wang, Yalin Wang, Chunhua Yang, Weihua Gui
publish: 2025 CAA Symposium on Fault Detection, Supervision, and Safety for Technical Processes (SAFEPROCESS)
abstract: Key quality prediction is crucial in the process industry for effective process control and monitoring. Recently, Transformer-based models have demonstrated remarkable success due to their powerful multi-head attention mechanism for sequence modeling. However, the conventional approach of handling multiple attention heads fails to assess their importance in feature extraction, leading to redundancy from non-essential information. To address this issue, this paper introduces a novel Quality Relevance-Aware Multi-Head Attention for Transformer (QR-Former). First, the multi-head attention mechanism extracts features from the input sequence. Then, for each attention head, its outputs across all samples form multivariate feature time sequences. To establish relationships with the quality sequence, we compute the similarity between each univariate feature time sequence within a head and the corresponding quality label sequence. This enables us to quantify the importance of each head based on the overall similarity of its output feature dimensions. The extracted features from different heads are then weighted and concatenated for further modeling within the Transformer structure. QR-Former is applied to quality prediction for two datasets from an industrial hydrocracking process. Its effectiveness is validated through comparisons with mainstream Transformer-based methods.

title: AI Powered IoT System for Real-Time Plant Disease Detection Using YOLOv5
authors: Chellaboyana Divya Sree, G. Arjun Kumar, Ashwani Kumar Dubey, Puneet Sharma
publish: 2025 International Conference on Intelligent and Secure Engineering Solutions (CISES)
abstract: This research has a high-performance object detection model called YOLOv5 which is an IoT-integrated Edge-AI system for real-time plant disease detection. The new system leverages edge computing to process leaf images locally and also it reduces reliance on cloud-based infrastructure and enabling low-latency, real-time decision-making. To show model’s ability to classify various plant diseases with high precision a group of datasets of 20,638 annotated images is utilized here. The workflow includes things such as image acquisition, annotation, and preprocessing through Roboflow, followed by model training which is done in GPU-accelerated environment. To minimize computational overhead the trained model is deployed on resource-efficient edge devices, ensuring rapid and accurate disease detection. Experimental validation confirms the system’s high detection precision and instantaneity efficiency, making it is ideal for smart agriculture applications. By this it is shown that this approach enhances crop health monitoring and supports early intervention strategies, contributing to sustainable and technology-driven farming practices.

title: Analysis of Pulse Shapers in Split Hopkinson Pressure Bar Systems and a Novel Latent Space Based Spectral Evaluation Framework
authors: Furkan Kosova, Nuri Durlu
publish: 2025 9th International Symposium on Multidisciplinary Studies and Innovative Technologies (ISMSIT)
abstract: This study investigates pulse shapers as a solution to minimize the ripples occurred in Split Hopkinson Pressure Bar tests. Approximately 40 different pulse shaper models have been modeled in CAD environment and simulated using Finite Element Methods. To evaluate the performance of the designed pulse shapers on incident wave are determined in both time and frequency domain with four performance metrics. First time in the literature, each pulse shaper information is mapped to latent space based on PointNet approach. Later, these latent vectors are matched in frequency domain in terms of its spectral density on a t-SNE Map. This novel framework seeks a solution in the frequency domain to eliminate oscillations on the incident wave using various pulse shaper geometries.

title: Linear Matrix Computation via a Silicon Photonic Feedforward Balanced Network Chip
authors: Xinyu Yang, Yifan Liu, Ying Zhu, Jie Yan, Ming Luo, Dong Wang, Hongguang Zhang, Daigao Chen, Xi Xiao
publish: 2025 European Conference on Optical Communications (ECOC)
abstract: We present an <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$8 \times 8$</tex> linear matrix computation on an optical chip with 64 cascaded Mach-Zehnder interferometers. Our balanced feedforward architecture yields a correlation above 0.98 between experimental and theoretical matrices, offering an efficient, reconfigurable solution for large-scale matrix operations.

title: Programmable Lens Systems with Liquid Crystals Elastomers for High Capacity and Wide Steering Angle Wireless Optical Link
authors: Vincent van der Doef, Danqing Liu, Eduward Tangdiongga, Oded Raz
publish: 2025 European Conference on Optical Communications (ECOC)
abstract: This work demonstrates the use of light sensitive Liquid Crystal Elastomers to reposition a lens realizing a wide scan angle transmitter for optical wireless communication systems. Steering is achieved by using photoheating. Experimental results confirm error-free 10 Gbps OOK transmission at up to 15° steering. ©2025 The Author(s)

title: Performance Comparison of Backscatter Receivers
authors: Nicolas Barbot, Arnaud Vena, Matt Reynolds
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on RFID Technology and Applications (RFID-TA)
abstract: This paper presents and compares three receiver architectures used to detect backscattered signals. These receivers are able to estimate the magnitude and phase of the reflection coefficient between the transponder antenna and the transponder circuit. Thus, the complex reflection coefficient can be estimated remotely. Impedance of the load connected to the antenna can thus be remotely estimated. Prototype is designed and characterized in real environment. Results show that the reflection coefficient and/or load impedance connected to the tag antenna can be determined in real environment.

title: Disambiguating Investment Entities in Enterprise Graphs: A Hybrid Approach with Graph Neural Networks and Embedding Models
authors: Hiral Raval
publish: 2025 International Conference on Intelligent and Secure Engineering Solutions (CISES)
abstract: In enterprise knowledge graphs, the occurrence of multiple entities sharing identical names introduces substantial ambiguity, especially when analyzing investment relationships. This ambiguity can hinder accurate decision-making and investment analysis. This study explores a unique approach to Named Entity Disambiguation (NED) within enterprise graphs by leveraging advanced machine learning techniques, specifically Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) and Shallow Graph Node Embeddings. By incorporating both local node features and global graph structure, our model effectively differentiates between entities with the same name based on their surrounding context within the graph. We introduce a new methodology for embedding entities that enhances the recognition of subtle differences, improving the overall precision of the disambiguation process. Through comparative analysis with traditional graph-based models like Node2Vec and Strongly Connected Component Algorithms (SCCA), we demonstrate that our approach yields significant improvements in resolving entity conflicts, thus enabling more accurate investment insights and better risk management in financial networks.

title: Exploring the Synergy of Augmented Reality and Smart Tourism in the Digital Era: Integrating IoT, 5G, and Big Data for Enhanced Travel Experiences
authors: Ling Sing Angeline Lee, Giap Weng Ng
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Engineering and Technology (IICAIET)
abstract: The tourism industry is experiencing a digital transformation, driven by the convergence of emerging technologies like Augmented Reality (AR), the Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, and Big Data. These technologies are reshaping the sector by enhancing user experiences, optimizing operations, and promoting sustainability. AR enables immersive experiences such as virtual tours and interactive storytelling, fostering cultural appreciation and engagement. IoT provides real-time, context-aware systems that personalize services and improve safety and operational efficiency. The rollout of 5G networks ensures high-speed, low-latency connectivity, facilitating seamless AR experiences, even in crowded or remote locations. Big Data supports personalized recommendations and resource optimization by analyzing tourist behavior and forecasting demand. The integration of these technologies addresses key challenges in tourism, including overcrowding, resource management, and environmental sustainability. AR and IoT work together to enhance personalized navigation and dynamic content, while 5G enables real-time applications like interactive 3D projections and virtual time travel. However, challenges such as high implementation costs, privacy concerns, and system interoperability remain. To fully capitalize on these technologies, tourism operators must make strategic investments and overcome these obstacles. By doing so, they can create sustainable, innovative tourism experiences that meet evolving consumer expectations, ensuring long-term growth and success in the industry.

title: A Computational Model for Stress Intervention using Affective Brain-Computer Interfaces
authors: Ain Shaheada Abdul Rahim Dapit, Marini Othman, Muna Azuddin, Asmarani Ahmad Puzi, Untung Rahardja
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Engineering and Technology (IICAIET)
abstract: Stress is a growing public health concern that negatively impacts individual well-being, making accurate detection of stress emotions essential yet challenging due to the limitations of self-reporting and the complexity of emotional states. Electroencephalography (EEG) offers an objective means to monitor brain activity related to stress emotions, but effective interpretation requires advanced analytical methods. This research aims to develop a reliable EEG-based model for stress emotion detection by collecting EEG data from participants exposed to stress-inducing stimuli and applying machine learning techniques for classification. The expected outcome is an improved stress detection model that augments traditional subjective measures. By advancing EEG-based stress emotion detection, this study seeks to contribute to better mental health interventions and more effective management of stress-related conditions.

title: Robust Load Forecasting for EV Charging Stations under FDIA via Fuzzy Logic Control Transformer Networks
authors: Haixiang Zhang, Fengyi Zhang, Ziqi Huang, Wenjing Huang, Junjie Li, Jian Sun
publish: 2025 CAA Symposium on Fault Detection, Supervision, and Safety for Technical Processes (SAFEPROCESS)
abstract: The frequent False Data Injection Attacks (FDIA) caused by the increase in the number of charging stations and the high uncertainty of electric vehicle charging have made it increasingly difficult to accurately predict the load of charging stations. To this end, a short-term load forecasting architecture method based on Fuzzy Logic Control Transformer (FLCT) is proposed. Firstly, a fuzzy confidence function based on sliding variance, correlation between load and price/usage rate is constructed through fuzzy logic design to generate a credibility score for each time step to reduce the impact of attacks. Then, fuzzy weighting is introduced into the attention mechanism of Transformer to focus on high-confidence data and strengthen the learning of normal load data. Finally, through experimental analysis of contaminated data under different attack levels, the results show that the proposed method has good prediction performance and strong robustness, and can effectively predict the load of charging stations under attack, ensuring the smooth operation of the power system.

title: ViT-driven Visual Extraction in R2GenCMN for medical report generation
authors: Chao Ling, Jing Wang, Junyan Fan, Meng Zhou
publish: 2025 CAA Symposium on Fault Detection, Supervision, and Safety for Technical Processes (SAFEPROCESS)
abstract: Medical imaging is a critical tool for diagnosing diseases. Its textual interpretation is vital for analysis and treatment planning. Automating report generation eases radiologists’ workload and boosts clinical automation. This field has gained attention with the development of AI in healthcare. Prior studies often used pre-trained CNNs like VGG and ResNet for feature extraction. However, despite their effectiveness, their local receptive fields limit the ability to capture global context. To overcome this limitation, this study proposes a novel approach, ViT-R2GenCMN, which employs the Vision Transformer (ViT) to replace the traditional CNN-based visual extractor. ViT processes images by segmenting them into patch sequences and utilizes a self-attention mechanism to directly model global dependencies. In this work, we integrate ViT into the Cross-modal Memory Networks (CMN) framework to improve the alignment between visual and textual information, thereby enhancing the quality of generated radiology reports. This paper examines the applicability of ViT in the task of radiology report generation and evaluates its specific impact on cross-modal interaction performance. The experimental results on the widely recognized IU X-Ray benchmark dataset are satisfactory. ViT-R2GenCMN achieved scores of 0.163 and 0.576 on the BLEU-4 and CIDEr evaluation metrics, respectively. These results demonstrate a certain improvement compared to previous models.

title: ETL Process Optimization and Data Warehouse Construction for the Main Structural Quality Testing Data of Prefabricated Concrete Buildings Based on AAS
authors: Xizhong Zhang, Xinliang Duan
publish: 2025 9th International Symposium on Multidisciplinary Studies and Innovative Technologies (ISMSIT)
abstract: This paper studies and analyzes how to optimize the ETL (Extract, Transform, and Load) process of the main structure quality inspection data of prefabricated concrete buildings under the framework of data governance, and constructs an efficient data warehouse. By analyzing the existing data governance framework and its applications, combined with the characteristics of the main structure quality inspection data of prefabricated concrete buildings, the paper proposes targeted ETL process optimization solutions and data warehouse construction methods. Through research and practice, it is proved that the optimized ETL process can significantly improve data processing efficiency and accuracy, while the data warehouse constructed provides a solid data foundation for subsequent analysis and warning of quality problems of the main structure of prefabricated concrete buildings.

title: DiffuseNet: A Hybrid cGAN and Diffusion Model Framework for Enhanced SAR Image Colorization
authors: Sripriya Addanki, Rohan Anantapur, Pranav Rao Pernankil, Manav Madhusudhan Nayak, Prema Ramasamy
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Engineering and Technology (IICAIET)
abstract: Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) imagery has emerged as a critical tool in remote sensing because it can be used to take images under any weather conditions and during day or night. Though SAR imagery has its benefits, it tends to have low visual interpretability due to its grayscale nature, noise and lack of fine detail, which can cause it to be viewed as less useful for applications that need human interpretation. In order to solve these difficulties, DiffuseNet is proposed, a new two-stage deep learning model for coloring and enhancing SAR images to make it more visually interpretable. For the first stage, a conditional Generative Adversarial Network (cGAN) is employed for colorization, with grayscale SAR images being converted to their colored versions through discovering the correspondence between the input intensity patterns and valid color distributions. This provides semantic richness and contextual depth to the images. In the second phase, a self-evolving diffusion model is used to further enhance the images by removing noise, sharpening and enhancing texture consistency, thus yielding clearer and more realistic results. The synergy of the generative ability of cGAN and the denoising ability of diffusion models allows DiffuseNet to produce high-quality, color-augmented SAR images. Experimentation indicates that improved performance is obtained by our approach in both visual and numerical comparisons, over existing methods. By offering improved clarity and colorization, DiffuseNet is introduced as a powerful tool for a wide range of remote sensing applications such as environmental monitoring, land cover classification, disaster assessment and surveillance.

title: Transfer-Learning-Driven Neural Network Equalization for Ultra-High-Capacity $254.7-\text{Tb} / \mathrm{s}$ Over $200-\text{km}$ SSMF
authors: Qingyu He, Tianqian Zhang, Ming Luo, Guoxing Zheng, Yaqin Wang, Liang Mei, Yan Wu, Xu Zhang, Zhixue He, Dechao Zhang, Mingqing Zuo, Dong Wang, Xi Xiao
publish: 2025 European Conference on Optical Communications (ECOC)
abstract: We experimentally demonstrate a GMI-estimated 254.7-Tb/s S+C+L band transmission applying DWDM over 200-km SSMF. NN-based equalizers applying transfer learning (TL) are deployed parallelly and the RX-DSP of each WDM channel is optimized. Covering 19.8-THz spectrum, the system SE reaches 12.86-bit/s/Hz. ©2025 The Author(s)

title: Power Consumption Analysis of QKD Networks Under Different Protocols and Detector Configurations
authors: Jiaheng Xiong, Qiaolun Zhang, Yoann Piétri, Raja Yehia, Raouf Boutaba, Francesco Musumeci, Massimo Tornatore
publish: 2025 European Conference on Optical Communications (ECOC)
abstract: We analyze the power consumption of quantum key distribution (QKD) networks under various protocol and detector configurations. Using realistic network topologies, we evaluate discrete-variable vs continuous-variable QKD and optimize device placement, quantifying power trade-offs of SNSPD vs APD detectors and the benefits of optical bypass.

title: Adjustable Robust Optimization Technique for P2MP Filterless Optical Networks Under Parameter Uncertainty
authors: Mohammad M. Hosseini, João Pedro, Antonio Napoli
publish: 2025 European Conference on Optical Communications (ECOC)
abstract: We applied Adjustable Robust Optimization (ARO) to P2MP filterless optical networks facing parameter uncertainty, analyzing robustness, performance, and complexity trade-offs. ARO shows significant advantages over non-adjustable methods, achieving resiliency and reducing amplifiers, particularly at higher uncertainties when non-adjustable counterparts fail.

title: Net 400-Gb/s/lane O-band IM-DD Transmission Using 182-GBd PAM-6 with KP4+SFEC over 20-km SSMF
authors: Hiroki Taniguchi, Shuto Yamamoto, Masanori Nakamura, Yukinobu Nakajima, Etsushi Yama-zaki
publish: 2025 European Conference on Optical Communications (ECOC)
abstract: We experimentally demonstrate single-lane 20-km transmission of net 400 Gb/s/lane assuming KP4+SFEC. The combination of KP4+SFEC and 182-GBd PAM-6 achieves net 400Gb/s/lane with the lowest BER floor ~3E-4 and lower FEC latency than soft-decision FEC, by mitigating analogue bandwidth distortion using nonlinear MLSE. ©2025 The Author(s)

title: Post-Quantum Cryptography for Securing Next-Generation Communication Networks
authors: J. Logeshwaran, S. Dhanasekaran, Mukhtar Sama, Dayal Chandra Sati, Jitendra Kumar, Amit Garg
publish: 2025 International Conference on Intelligent and Secure Engineering Solutions (CISES)
abstract: Advancements in Quantum Key Distribution (QKD) and lattice-based encryption are paving the way for PQC adoption, but challenges remain, such as performance overhead and compatibility with existing infrastructure. It evaluates whether PQC schemes are feasible for real-time applications in high-speed, low-latency networks and analyzes the security-performance trade-offs. We investigate standardized candidates from NIST's PQC Project (e.g., CRYSTALS-Kyber, Dilithium) and their resistance to hybrid attacks. In addition, we also investigate the hardware acceleration (e.g., FPGA, ASIC) approach to alleviate the latency bottleneck. Transition strategies, such as hybrid cryptography (the coupling of classical and PQC algorithms) and zero-trust frameworks to maintain backward compatibility, are a key focus here. We further discuss side-channel vulnerabilities specific to PQC implementations and suggest mitigation strategies. These findings emphasize the need for a continued focus in areas such as scalability, standardization and quantum secure key distribution and the importance of collaboration between academia, industry and policymakers." By tackling these issues, PQC can secure next-gen networks from quantum dangers while aging to be efficient and trustworthy.

title: Reliability Analysis based on Fault Tree Analysis for SSCB Snubber Circuit Employing Inverse Current Injection Method
authors: Jae-seong Jo, Jae-Hun Cha, Guangxu Zhou, Feel-soon Kang
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Engineering and Technology (IICAIET)
abstract: Using the inverse current injection method, zero current switching can effectively suppress the surge voltage during SSCB's switch turn-off. However, it requires additional auxiliary components such as resonant circuits and thyristors, which increase circuit complexity and may increase the failure rate. In this paper, Fault Tree Analysis (FTA) is conducted to identify the failure modes of the snubber circuit and to analyze its reliability by reflecting its operational characteristics. It was confirmed that the SSCB's switch exhibits a long lifespan because it does not perform frequent operations, unlike general power electronic systems.

title: Mid-Span Optically Powered Remote Sensor Module Using Residual Raman Pump Light
authors: Patrick Iannone, Cuong Tran, Gregory Raybon, Michael Straub, Kao-Yang Huang, Ellsworth Burrows, Ettore Biondi, Mikael Mazur
publish: 2025 European Conference on Optical Communications (ECOC)
abstract: We demonstrate an optically-powered acoustic sensor module, located along a 123-km Ra-man-amplified <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$31 \times 400 ~\text{Gb} / \mathrm{s}$</tex> DWDM link. Residual Raman pump light both powers the sensor module and serves as the optical carrier for transmitting acoustic signals.

title: Evaluation of Various Sequential Constructive Approaches for Optimizing Vehicle Routing Problem with Time Windows
authors: Hongyi Du, Yoshitaka Tanimizu
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Engineering and Technology (IICAIET)
abstract: Evolutionary algorithms and genetic algorithms have been widely applied to routing optimization problems due to their outstanding performance. Among them, Sequential Constructive Crossover (SCX) is regarded as one of the most effective crossover operators. Although SCX was originally designed to solve the Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP), it has also been successfully applied to the Capacitated Vehicle Routing Problem (CVRP) in recent years. However, currently, there is no literature reporting the application of SCX to the Vehicle Routing Problem with Time Windows (VRPTW). This paper adapts and implements several variants of the SCX operator within a genetic algorithm framework tailored for VRPTW, systematically comparing their performance in benchmark instances. Furthermore, several other commonly used crossover operators are compared. The experimental results demonstrate that the proposed method exhibits both high efficiency and effectiveness in solving VRPTW.

title: Collaborative Optimization for Green Carbon Reduction in New Power Systems: Multi-Entity Interaction Across Research, Standards, and Industry
authors: Tiantian Chen, Wenqing Li, Lian Liu, Ling Luo, Yong Li
publish: 2025 9th International Symposium on Multidisciplinary Studies and Innovative Technologies (ISMSIT)
abstract: This document presents a complete model for maximizing green carbon reduction activities in new power system grid elements through combined efforts of scientific researchers and standard developers with industry participants. For sustainable outcomes technological advancement requires integration with regulatory structures and industrial operation processes. The foundational step involves identifying and visualizing essential carbon reduction entities and their various connections and dependency relationships. The system links scientific data with operational and regulatory requirements by using a single platform that enables collaborative decisions. This model merges network energy pattern analysis alongside carbon emission pattern analysis to help operators identify key locations where emissions reach their peak levels. The system uses adaptive feedback control to integrate newly developed research and evolving regulations while ensuring long-term compatibility and adherence to standards. The proposed method establishes advanced carbon management technology for power grids through collaboration among sectors to deliver novel sustainable results.

title: A Blockchain Integrated Machine Learning Framework for Cryptographic Algorithm Identification
authors: Prashant Kumar Jha, Salman Ahmed, Nanthini N
publish: 2025 International Conference on Intelligent and Secure Engineering Solutions (CISES)
abstract: In cybersecurity, the identification of cryptographic algorithms is very important to perform digital forensics, intrusion detection and reverse engineering. This paper brings forward a framework to identify the type of cryptographic algorithm used to encrypt the given text. The framework is a combination of machine learning and blockchain technologies. Individual machine learning models are trained for a particular cryptographic algorithm like AES, DES, RSA, SHA256 and Blowfish. ML algorithms like CNN, SVM, Hybrid KNN+RF, XGBoost are used to train the models. Each machine learning model is then placed in individual blockchain nodes. When a user inputs a ciphertext, it is analysed by all the blockchain nodes. Every node runs its model and a prediction output is generated. The model with the highest confidence score is then used for the final classification. The system also has a dynamic trust value mechanism where the node’s credibility is updated dynamically based upon the accuracy. A smart contract is put in place to ensure secure processing and logging. The output is visualized and displayed in an interactive user interface. The accuracy of all the models is pretty high proving the worth of this system. This is a scalable and decentralized method for identifying cryptographic algorithms, which can be used both in research and security operations.

title: Spatiotemporal Source Trajectory Tracking using Multiplexed Optomechanical Fiber-Optic FPI Sensors_supp1-3640121.pdf
authors: Jiajun Tian
publish: N/A
abstract: Low-frequency acoustic source tracking is essential for early fault diagnosis and structural health monitoring, yet conventional fiber-optic acoustic sensors that use circular diaphragms face fundamental trade-offs among radius, thickness, and material strength that limit sensitivity and robustness. This work proposes an optomechanical fiber-optic acoustic sensor employing an aluminum spiral-beams–supported diaphragm with a tunable resonant frequency, integrated into a Fabry–Pérot interferometer. Finite-element-guided design and experiments demonstrate a calibrated sensitivity of 6.127 V/Pa, a minimum detectable pressure of 51.23 μPa / √Hz at 112 Hz, and a frequency response spanning 50 Hz to 20 kHz. To enable spatiotemporal tracking, we build a four-sensor array and develop a real-time adaptive strong-tracking unscented Kalman filter (AST-UKF) pipeline that enhances TDOA-based localization under low-SNR, reverberant conditions, reconstructing moving-source trajectories with 0.88 cm RMSE. The combination of low-frequency-optimized sensing and array-level inference yields a compact, passive, and electro-magnetic interference immune platform for weak-signal detection and trajectory tracking, providing practical support for online monitoring and decision-making in industrial environments.

title: 3D-Printed Sensor on a Multicore Fiber for Triple-Parameter Sensing
authors: Tailei Cheng, Yuhan Zhang, Bowen Zhang, Shan Gao, Yan Liu, Peng Ye, Jing Yang, Ping Li, Jinhui Shi, K. T. V. Grattan, Chunying Guan
publish: Journal of Lightwave Technology
abstract: Multi-core fiber (MCF), with a multichannel structure, can serve very effectively as an alternative sensing platform for measuring multiple physical parameters using a single fiber. Femtosecond laser 3D printing technology significantly improves the integration of the devices, due to high processing precision and flexibility it offers. A triple-parameter sensor based on Fabry-Pérot (FP) cavities on a multicore fiber tip was demonstrated. Three different FP cavities were fabricated by femtosecond laser 3D printing on the end faces of the three fiber cores. Temperature, humidity, and pressure were measured using a fluid-infiltrated closed microcavity, an open air-cavity, and a closed hollow cavity, respectively. The sensitivities of these devices were shown to be -182.4 pm/°C, 109 pm/% RH, and 11.24 pm/kPa respectively. This tiny fiber-tip sensor created in this way has the advantages of compact structure, small volume, ease of packaging and low cost. The sensor discussed thus enables monitoring of temperature, humidity, and pressure, and as a device has the potential to be applied in chemical manufacturing and storage, to reduce the risk of leakage and explosion of hazardous chemicals through better in situ monitoring.

title: Efficient and Scalable Point Cloud Generation With Sparse Point-Voxel Diffusion Models_supp1-3636409.mp4
authors: Ioannis Romanelis
publish: N/A
abstract: We propose a novel point cloud U-Net diffusion architecture for 3-D generative modeling capable of generating high-quality and diverse 3-D shapes while maintaining fast generation times. Our network employs a dual-branch architecture, combining the high-resolution representations of points with the computational efficiency of sparse voxels. Our fastest variant outperforms all nondiffusion generative approaches on unconditional shape generation, the most popular benchmark for evaluating point cloud generative models, while our largest model achieves state-of-the-art results among diffusion methods, with a runtime approximately 70% of the previously state-of-the-art point-voxel diffusion (PVD), measured on the same hardware setting. Beyond unconditional generation, we perform extensive evaluations, including conditional generation on all categories of ShapeNet, demonstrating the scalability of our model to larger datasets, and implicit generation, which allows our network to produce high-quality point clouds on fewer timesteps, further decreasing the generation time. Finally, we evaluate the architecture’s performance in point cloud completion and super-resolution. Our model excels in all tasks, establishing it as a state-of-the-art diffusion U-Net for point cloud generative modeling. The code is publicly available at <uri xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">https://github.com/JohnRomanelis/SPVD</uri>
